caption:
Playing catch up on some long overdue projects.
This little Dino got completed just in time for my youngest niece’s 1st birthday. I made it as interest for the very late granny square blanket I also gifted her using the same coloured yarn.

Pattern: Timothy the T-Rex 🦖 by @bluephonestudios
Yarn: Bernat Softee Baby in Soft Red and Princess Pebbles
alt: Small crocheted dinosaur with bead eyes being held up

caption:
Thrift find! Do you ever hunt for crochet books in thrift stores? This was an amazing 🤩 find for me this weekend! We recently bought a little cottage that we’re renovating and I keep dreaming of making vintage inspired throws and pillows. This pattern book was published in 1979 and has the exact patterns I was wishing to recreate. Such a cool find! 😍😍😍

#thrifting #crochet #crochetersofinstagram #crochetaddict #vintagestyle #crochetafghan

The Highlands Poncho Crochet Pattern is RELEASED on Etsy & Ravelry!!!

To celebrate the release, all @creativeartscrochet patterns will be 25% off until Friday! Check out the link in my bio to grab your copy!

Pattern details:
▪️Yarn: Worsted (weight 4)
▪️Hooks: 4.00mm & 5.00mm
▪️3 sizes: (XS/S/M), (L/XL/2X), (3X/4X/5X)
▪️Detailed written instructions with schematics and photo tutorials

Level required - Adventurous Beginner 🫶

caption:
Meet the Maker! This is long overdue!!! I’ve been especially quiet designing my first pattern in the background so thank you for your patience with my lack of posts lately.

My name is Amanda Arts and I’m a self-taught crocheter who learned off a Reader’s Digest Magazine over 10 years ago. It wasn’t a skill I kept up with and it was basically dormant until I became an Aunt. I wanted a crazy Aunt skill to haunt these children with for their entire lives; imagining ugly sweaters, hats, scarfs, blankets and things I could make them. 🤪 Our family has welcomed three babies who received a classic granny square blanket and a hat or two until COVID became part of our regular vocabulary.

When the first lockdown was issued, I decided to challenge myself and crochet a sweater, calling it my “COVID cardigan”. I thought by the time COVID was over I would have a sweater to brag about. I made that sweater and another and another and another….. Obviously we’re all well aware that it still hasn’t ended and I’ve basically created a wardrobe since then.

I have a day job that involves a significant amount of data analysis so having a creative outlet is super important to me. As I’ve been designing, my day job has provided a significant amount of transferable skills which has allowed me to essentially act as my own tech editor. 🤞🤞🤞 In a week or two I’ll be ready for a testing call which I’m really looking forward to.

So that’s me in a nutshell about how I started crocheting. I’ll share more as I lead up to introducing some of my own work. Thanks for reading and being part of my journey! ❤️❤️❤️

#creativeartscrochet #crochet #croche #croché #crochê #crochetaddict #crochetersofinstagram #makersgonnamake #makers #handmade #imadethis #makersofinstagram #whatsonmyhook #goals #crafty
alt: Amanda smiling in a custom crochet cardigan

caption:
My very first model showing off my work 🤩🥰❤️

This beautiful model also happens to be my mom ☺️ and she’s wearing the 2 Ways to Wear Cardi I gifted her last summer. The pattern design is by @outstandingcrochet who I’m a crochet super-fan of. The level of detail Natalia provides in her patterns is unreal! I fully credit her designs for giving me the confidence needed to get from beginner level into the realm of advanced and intermediate work. ❤️

#creativeartscrochet #crochet #croche #croché #crochê #crochetaddict #crochetersofinstagram #makersgonnamake #makers #handmade #imadethis #makersofinstagram #whatsonmyhook #goals #crafty
alt: Amanda's mom smiling in a custom crochet shawl

caption:
This cardigan is one of my favourites!

I made it while visiting family in British Columbia earlier in the fall. This sweater brings me back to all the ferry rides we took between the Gulf Islands and lounging on the porch of a cabin on Galiano Island watching the evening sun.

The pattern is another great one by @outstandingcrochet
I made some minor alterations and shortened the sleeves to 3/4 length. I also added ribbing to the cuffs and bottom edge.

Pattern: Aquatic Crochet Cardigan
Yarn: Caron Simply Soft Dark Country Blue

#caron #caronsimplysoft #yarnspirations #creativeartscrochet #crochet #crochetaddict #crochetersofinstagram #makersgonnamake #makers #makersofinstagram #whatsonmyhook #goals #crafty
